items.title: US Pursuit of Third Oil Tanker Intensifies Venezuela Blockade
Oil prices gain on US interception of Venezuelan oil tanker over weekend
U.S. pursuing third oil tanker off Venezuela coast, official says
items.standfirst: The U.S. Coast Guard is pursuing another sanctioned oil tanker near Venezuela, a U.S. official tells CBS News. It's another move by the Trump administration to put pressure on Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro. Willie James Inman reports.
items.content: The U.S. Coast Guard is pursuing another sanctioned oil tanker near Venezuela, a U.S. official tells CBS News. It's another move by the Trump administration to put pressure on Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro. Willie James Inman reports.

items.title: Coast Guard is pursuing another tanker helping Venezuela skirt sanctions, US official says
U.S. Coast Guard 'in active pursuit' of third vessel off Venezuelan coast
items.standfirst: The U.S. Coast Guard “is in active pursuit” of a sanctioned vessel in international waters off the coast of Venezuela, two U.S. officials with knowledge of the matter tell NBC News. NBC News’ Daniele Hamamdjian reports.
items.content: The U.S. Coast Guard “is in active pursuit” of a sanctioned vessel in international waters off the coast of Venezuela, two U.S. officials with knowledge of the matter tell NBC News. NBC News’ Daniele Hamamdjian reports.

items.title: US pursuing third oil tanker linked to Venezuela, official says
items.standfirst: The move comes days after President Donald Trump said that he was ordering a blockade of sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela.
items.content: The move comes days after President Donald Trump said that he was ordering a blockade of sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela.

items.title: US in 'active pursuit' of third vessel off Venezuelan coast, officials say
items.standfirst: The US is in "active pursuit" of a third oil tanker near Venezuela in the Caribbean Sea, officials have said.
items.content: The US is in "active pursuit" of a third oil tanker near Venezuela in the Caribbean Sea, officials have said.

items.title: US pursues third oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela
items.standfirst: US coastguard 'in active pursuit' of a dark fleet vessel trying to evade sanctions on Venezuela, an official says.
items.content: US coastguard 'in active pursuit' of a dark fleet vessel trying to evade sanctions on Venezuela, an official says.

items.title: US pursuing third vessel near Venezuela, officials say
items.standfirst: The US Coast Guard is pursuing an oil ⁠tanker in international waters near Venezuela in what would be the third in less than a week, officials said Sunday, as US President Donald Trump increases pressure on the South American nation. The move comes a week after Trump announced a "blockade" of all oil tankers under sanctions entering and leaving Venezuela.
items.content: The US Coast Guard is pursuing an oil ⁠tanker in international waters near Venezuela in what would be the third in less than a week, officials said Sunday, as US President Donald Trump increases pressure on the South American nation. The move comes a week after Trump announced a "blockade" of all oil tankers under sanctions entering and leaving Venezuela.

items.title: Oil tanker seized off Venezuela, the second in two weeks
items.standfirst: The US seized an oil tanker off Venezuela's coast on Saturday. It's the second time in two weeks that US forces have carried out such an action. This comes after President Donald Trump announced a block of "sanctioned oil vessels" entering and exiting Venezuela. Catherine Viette has more details.
items.content: The US seized an oil tanker off Venezuela's coast on Saturday. It's the second time in two weeks that US forces have carried out such an action. This comes after President Donald Trump announced a block of "sanctioned oil vessels" entering and exiting Venezuela. Catherine Viette has more details.

items.title: U.S. Coast Guard intercepts second vessel off Venezuelan coast
items.standfirst: The United States Coast Guard is intercepting a second vessel off the Venezuelan coast, two U.S. officials confirm to NBC News. NBC News’ Julie Tsirkin has the latest.
items.content: The United States Coast Guard is intercepting a second vessel off the Venezuelan coast, two U.S. officials confirm to NBC News. NBC News’ Julie Tsirkin has the latest.

items.title: Live: US, Ukraine hail 'productive' Miami talks but no breakthrough
items.standfirst: US and Ukrainian envoys issued a joint statement on Sunday that hailed "productive and constructive" talks in Miami but did not announce any apparent breakthrough in efforts to end the war with Russia. Follow our liveblog for all the latest.
items.content: US and Ukrainian envoys issued a joint statement on Sunday that hailed "productive and constructive" talks in Miami but did not announce any apparent breakthrough in efforts to end the war with Russia. Follow our liveblog for all the latest.

items.content: US envoy holds separate meetings with Russian and Ukrainian negotiators in Miami on ending Russia's war in Ukraine.

items.title: US and Ukraine call Miami talks productive despite no breakthrough
items.standfirst: Donald Trump's special envoy, Steve Witkoff, issued a statement with the top Ukrainian negotiator after discussing the latest peace plans.
items.content: Donald Trump's special envoy, Steve Witkoff, issued a statement with the top Ukrainian negotiator after discussing the latest peace plans.

items.title: US envoy Witkoff calls Ukraine talks in Miami 'productive'
items.standfirst: US special envoy Steve Witkoff called weekend talks in Florida “productive and constructive” as officials from the US, Europe, and Ukraine worked to align positions. President Donald Trump pushes for a quick end to the nearly four-year conflict, but Russia wants to keep seized Ukrainian land.
items.content: US special envoy Steve Witkoff called weekend talks in Florida “productive and constructive” as officials from the US, Europe, and Ukraine worked to align positions. President Donald Trump pushes for a quick end to the nearly four-year conflict, but Russia wants to keep seized Ukrainian land.

items.content: Putin aide Yury Ushakov's remarks come a day after US and Russian officials held talks on the US proposal in Florida.

items.title: Kremlin renews criticism of Europe’s efforts to amend US plan to end Ukraine war
items.standfirst: Putin’s top foreign policy aid says proposals could prolong conflict as talks with US negotiators are held in MiamiRussia has renewed its criticism of efforts by Europe and Ukraine to amend US proposals to end the war in Ukraine, saying they did not improve prospects for peace.Vladimir Putin’s top foreign policy aide, Yuri Ushakov, told reporters on Sunday that the proposed tweaks to Washington’s plan could prolong the conflict. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: The talks to end the war in Ukraine shifted back to the U.S. this weekend, with Russian President Vladimir Putin’s envoy calling discussions “constructive” as Washington pushes for a peace deal by Christmas.
items.content: The talks to end the war in Ukraine shifted back to the U.S. this weekend, with Russian President Vladimir Putin’s envoy calling discussions “constructive” as Washington pushes for a peace deal by Christmas.

clusters.title: Another 130 abducted schoolchildren released in Nigeria
clusters.neutral_headline: Another 130 abducted schoolchildren released in Nigeria

items.standfirst: Nigerian authorities confirm the remaining students kidnapped from a Catholic school last month have been freed.
items.content: Nigerian authorities confirm the remaining students kidnapped from a Catholic school last month have been freed.

items.title: Nigeria says 130 abducted schoolchildren freed after mass kidnapping
items.standfirst: Nigerian authorities said Sunday they have secured the release of 130 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic boarding school in Niger state, bringing the total freed to more than 200 after a mass kidnapping in November. The announcement follows weeks of uncertainty over the fate of students taken by gunmen, amid renewed concern over Nigeria’s worsening kidnap-for-ransom crisis.
items.content: Nigerian authorities said Sunday they have secured the release of 130 schoolchildren abducted from a Catholic boarding school in Niger state, bringing the total freed to more than 200 after a mass kidnapping in November. The announcement follows weeks of uncertainty over the fate of students taken by gunmen, amid renewed concern over Nigeria’s worsening kidnap-for-ransom crisis.

items.title: 130 children and staff abducted from Nigerian school last month freed 'in time for Christmas'

items.content: The remaining 130 schoolchildren and staff abducted by gunmen from a Catholic school in Nigeria last month have been freed.

items.standfirst: The country has seen a wave of recent mass abductions, as it suffers from multiple interlinked security concerns.
items.content: The country has seen a wave of recent mass abductions, as it suffers from multiple interlinked security concerns.

items.title: Another 130 kidnapped schoolchildren released in Nigeria
items.standfirst: Presidential spokesperson says all those abducted from a Catholic school in Niger state last month are now freeNigerian authorities say they have secured the release of a further 130 schoolchildren kidnapped from a Catholic school in November, after 100 were freed earlier this month.“Another 130 abducted Niger state pupils released, none left in captivity,” presidential spokesperson Sunday Dare said on X, in a post accompanied by a photo of smiling children. Continue reading...
items.content: Presidential spokesperson says all those abducted from a Catholic school in Niger state last month are now freeNigerian authorities say they have secured the release of a further 130 schoolchildren kidnapped from a Catholic school in November, after 100 were freed earlier this month.“Another 130 abducted Niger state pupils released, none left in captivity,” presidential spokesperson Sunday Dare said on X, in a post accompanied by a photo of smiling children. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Israel approves 19 new Jewish settlements in occupied West Bank
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel approves 19 new Jewish settlements in occupied West Bank

items.title: Israel approves 19 new Jewish settlements in occupied West Bank
items.standfirst: Israel has approved 19 new Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank in a fresh blow to the possibility of a Palestinian state.
items.content: Israel has approved 19 new Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank in a fresh blow to the possibility of a Palestinian state.

items.title: Israel approves 19 new West Bank settlements
items.standfirst: Israel has approved 19 new settlements in the occupied West Bank, bringing the three-year total to 69. The move comes despite the UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres' recent condemnation of what he called the "relentless" expansion of settlements in the occupied territory.
items.content: Israel has approved 19 new settlements in the occupied West Bank, bringing the three-year total to 69. The move comes despite the UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres' recent condemnation of what he called the "relentless" expansion of settlements in the occupied territory.

items.title: Israel approves 19 new Jewish settlements in occupied West Bank
items.standfirst: Decision takes the total number of new settlements to 69 in past few years as construction binge continuesIsrael has approved a proposal for 19 new Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank as the government pushes ahead with a construction binge in the territory that poses a further threat to the possibility of a Palestinian state.It brings the total number of new settlements over the past few years to 69, a new record, according to the far-right finance minister, Bezalel Smotrich, who has pushed a settlement expansion agenda in the West Bank. The latest include two that were previously evacuated during a 2005 disengagement plan. Continue reading...
items.content: Decision takes the total number of new settlements to 69 in past few years as construction binge continuesIsrael has approved a proposal for 19 new Jewish settlements in the occupied West Bank as the government pushes ahead with a construction binge in the territory that poses a further threat to the possibility of a Palestinian state.It brings the total number of new settlements over the past few years to 69, a new record, according to the far-right finance minister, Bezalel Smotrich, who has pushed a settlement expansion agenda in the West Bank. The latest include two that were previously evacuated during a 2005 disengagement plan. Continue reading...

items.title: Israel approves 19 new settlements in occupied West Bank
items.standfirst: Far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said the move was about blocking the establishment of a Palestinian state.
items.content: Far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said the move was about blocking the establishment of a Palestinian state.

items.title: CBS News chief Bari Weiss pulls '60 Minutes' story, sparking outcry
items.standfirst: CBS News Editor-in-Chief Bari Weiss pulled a 60 Minutes segment on allegations of abuses at an El Salvador detention center where the Trump administration sent hundreds of Venezuelan migrants.
items.content: CBS News Editor-in-Chief Bari Weiss pulled a 60 Minutes segment on allegations of abuses at an El Salvador detention center where the Trump administration sent hundreds of Venezuelan migrants.(Image credit: Leigh Vogel)

items.title: CBS News delays 60 Minutes segment featuring investigation into El Salvador’s Cecot megaprison
items.standfirst: Backlash after broadcaster announces the program, which was due to air on Sunday night, ‘needs additional reporting’CBS News is facing a backlash from one of its own correspondents, and others, after it cancelled an upcoming 60 Minutes investigation into El Salvador’s brutal Cecot megaprison to which the Trump administration deported hundreds of migrants.The episode of its flagship program was due to air on Sunday night. However, in an “editors note” posted on X, the broadcaster’s official account announced that “the lineup for tonight’s edition of 60 Minutes has been updated. Our report ‘Inside Cecot’ will air in a future broadcast.” Continue reading...
items.content: Backlash after broadcaster announces the program, which was due to air on Sunday night, ‘needs additional reporting’CBS News is facing a backlash from one of its own correspondents, and others, after it cancelled an upcoming 60 Minutes investigation into El Salvador’s brutal Cecot megaprison to which the Trump administration deported hundreds of migrants.The episode of its flagship program was due to air on Sunday night. However, in an “editors note” posted on X, the broadcaster’s official account announced that “the lineup for tonight’s edition of 60 Minutes has been updated. Our report ‘Inside Cecot’ will air in a future broadcast.” Continue reading...

items.title: Hen cages and pig farrowing crates to be outlawed in England
items.standfirst: Humane slaughter requirements for farmed fish and end to puppy farming also in new package of animal welfare lawsCaged hens will be a thing of the past in England, the government has announced, as it launches a package of new animal welfare laws.Pig farrowing crates, which campaigners have said are cruel, will also be banned under the welfare changes. These cramped crates are used to stop pigs from rolling over and crushing their young, but once in them sows cannot turn over or move around at all. Continue reading...
items.content: Humane slaughter requirements for farmed fish and end to puppy farming also in new package of animal welfare lawsCaged hens will be a thing of the past in England, the government has announced, as it launches a package of new animal welfare laws.Pig farrowing crates, which campaigners have said are cruel, will also be banned under the welfare changes. These cramped crates are used to stop pigs from rolling over and crushing their young, but once in them sows cannot turn over or move around at all. Continue reading...

clusters.neutral_headline: Morocco seal AFCON win against Comoros in 2025 opener

items.title: Morocco seal AFCON win against Comoros in 2025 opener
items.standfirst: Host nation Morocco overcome a spirited challenge by Africa Cup of Nations minnows Comoros to kick off the tournament.
items.content: Host nation Morocco overcome a spirited challenge by Africa Cup of Nations minnows Comoros to kick off the tournament.

items.title: REPLAY: Africa Cup of Nations build-up special
items.standfirst: The African Cup of Nations opens in Rabat tonight with a match between the host country, Morocco and the Comoros. Ahead of kick-off, FRANCE 24's Emily Boyle was in the studio with special guests to talk all things AFCON.
items.content: The African Cup of Nations opens in Rabat tonight with a match between the host country, Morocco and the Comoros. Ahead of kick-off, FRANCE 24's Emily Boyle was in the studio with special guests to talk all things AFCON.

items.title: Africa Cup of Nations kicks off in Morocco
items.standfirst: The African Cup of nations opens in Rabat tonight with a match between the host country Morocco and the Comoros. It's a crucial event for the country, which is hoping to cement its status as a football superpower. The tournament will allow Morocco to show off infrastructure investments it is making ahead of the 2030 World Cup. The competition is hotly anticipated by Morocco fans - with the host team widely regarded as the favorite to win the African title. France24 Sport journalist Selina Sykes reports the latest from Rabat.
items.content: The African Cup of nations opens in Rabat tonight with a match between the host country Morocco and the Comoros. It's a crucial event for the country, which is hoping to cement its status as a football superpower. The tournament will allow Morocco to show off infrastructure investments it is making ahead of the 2030 World Cup. The competition is hotly anticipated by Morocco fans - with the host team widely regarded as the favorite to win the African title. France24 Sport journalist Selina Sykes reports the latest from Rabat.

items.title: Morocco faces high expectations as AFCON kicks off at home
items.standfirst: The Africa Cup of Nations begins this Sunday in Morocco, with the opening match in Rabat tonight featuring the hosts against Comoros. Morocco’s Atlas Lions are among the tournament favorites, but they will face tough competition from strong teams such as Senegal. RFI Sports Editor and correspondent from Morocco, Paul Myers, brings us with the latest.
items.content: The Africa Cup of Nations begins this Sunday in Morocco, with the opening match in Rabat tonight featuring the hosts against Comoros. Morocco’s Atlas Lions are among the tournament favorites, but they will face tough competition from strong teams such as Senegal. RFI Sports Editor and correspondent from Morocco, Paul Myers, brings us with the latest.
